case_vignette: A 45-year-old woman presents with 3 months of tender bumps on the shins! She says that 4 months ago, she was hospitalized for abdominal pain and was found to be positive for hepatitis B! She denies ever having tuberculosis! She denies itching or scratching at the bumps! She denies any rash on the trunk or extremities!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing tender bumps on my shins for the past three months.
Are the bumps red and inflamed?
Yes, the bumps are red and inflamed.
Have you noticed any changes in your recent weight or experienced joint pain?
No, I have not noticed any changes in my weight or experienced joint pain.
Do you have any other chronic diseases like diabetes or a recent history of taking any medications like oral contraceptives or antibiotics?
No, I do not have any other chronic diseases or a recent history of taking medications like oral contraceptives or antibiotics.
Have you recently had a strep throat infection or any other bacterial infection?
No, I have not recently had a strep throat infection or any other bacterial infection.
Do you have a history of similar symptoms, or is this the first occurrence?
This is the first occurrence of these symptoms.
Is there any history of similar symptoms or autoimmune diseases in your family?
No, there is no history of similar symptoms or autoimmune diseases in my family.
Final Diagnosis: Erythema nodosum.
